info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 14 at 5:43AM EDT until July 14 at 10:00AM EDT by NWS State College PA
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding along Muncy Creek from Hughesville downstream to the confluence of Muncy Creek with the Susquehanna River.
* WHERE...A portion of central Pennsylvania, including the following county, Lycoming.
* WHEN...Until 1000 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 537 AM EDT, Gauge reports indicated heavy rain. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen over the past hour and will delay the recession of water levels. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Muncy and Hughesville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EDT THIS MORNING
